result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert John Fawcett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be added to current payment plan for attorney fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert John Fawcett

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Robert John Fawcett appeared.  Court called at 10:04 a.m.  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State moves to ament Ct. 1 to (Misdemeanor Theft) Statute 943.(1)(a)(3)(a).  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1.  Crt reviews the drafted probable cause.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adudicated guilty of amended Ct 1 (Misdemeanor Theft) Statute 943.(1)(a)(3)(a). Sentencing arguments. Victim rights have been complied with.  Crt orders:

- Court orders costs of $243.00 to be added to the payment plan for attorney fees
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio   DF:  Robert John Fawcett appeared.  Court called at 11:05 a.m.  Set for arraignment.  DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty.  Not Guilty plea is entered.  Waive speedy trial.  DE is working on getting the restitution paid.   Set out for PTC.  Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on April 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Robert John Fawcett appeared.  Court called at 2:07 p.m.  Set for arraignment.  There has been an offer by the State.  Attorneys are working on a resolution.   DE has brought $1,500 to pay towards the restitution.  Continue the arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
From DE stating he forgot how much Rest he is supposed to pay.  Ret'd call to DE & left a v/m stating he should contact his Atty or the Criminal Desk w/further Q's. jaf

DE has not been able to pay the restitution.  DE has a tax return refund coming and asks to continue the arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

From a Shannon G re: pymt she made on behalf of DE.  Shannon stated that her pymt is being ret'd and doesn't understand why.  Upon further research, Shannon was informed that she made the pymt to the wrong place & will need to call GovPayNet to have her money refunded or moved to PLC#1586.  Shannon was advised that if the money cannot be transferred to the correct PLC #, she will need to make the pymt online again. jaf
Filed by ADA McKinley. km
Arraignment at 02-02-2016 09:00 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Alexis McKinley. DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio   DF:  Robert John Fawcett appeared. Case called at 10:10 a.m.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court directs parties to see Judge Lundell's JA to set another hearing.

From DE inquiring if pymt was rec'd as the DE sent pymt to his atty.  Ret'd call to DE & advised him that his Oct pymt was rec'd & next pymt of $50 is due 11-20-15.  DE inquired about the length of time he is to continue this Pplan & was advised to continue pymts until he was notified by the court & will receive a final bill once his case is closed & the atty submits their final bill. jaf

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 09-10-2015 02:30 pm

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Chad F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
